meanings.definition: A sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information.
meanings.sent1: She asked a question about the homework.
meanings.sent2: The teacher posed a question to the class.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book ask so many questions?
meanings.sent4: The question hung in the air, waiting for an answer.
meanings.sent5: The detective's question revealed the truth.

meanings.definition: A matter requiring resolution or discussion.
meanings.sent1: The budget issue was a big question for the committee.
meanings.sent2: The question of who would lead the team remained unanswered.
meanings.sent3: The question of what to have for lunch sparked a debate.
meanings.sent4: The looming question of the missing keys haunted her.
meanings.sent5: The ethical question troubled him deeply.

meanings.definition: To ask a question or questions.
meanings.sent1: He will question the witness in court.
meanings.sent2: She likes to question everything she reads.
meanings.sent3: The toddler questioned why the sky was blue.
meanings.sent4: The journalist questioned the politician's motives.
meanings.sent5: The scientist questioned the validity of the experiment.
